questions.question: The area of the kidney that contains the glomeruli and portions of the tubules is the:
questions.rationale: The cortex contains the glomeruli and tubules. The medulla, pyramids, and columns do not contain glomeruli.

questions.question: What is the functional unit of the kidney?
questions.rationale: The nephron is the functional unit; others are important but not functional units.

questions.question: Which cells have phagocytic properties and regulate capillary blood flow?
questions.rationale: Mesangial cells regulate capillary blood flow and have phagocytic activity.

questions.question: The only surface inside the nephron with microvilli (brush border) is the:
questions.rationale: The proximal convoluted tubule has cuboidal cells with a brush border to increase reabsorption surface area.

questions.question: What part of the kidney controls renal blood flow, GFR, and renin secretion?
questions.rationale: The JGA regulates renal blood flow, GFR, and renin secretion.

questions.question: Kidney stones in the upper ureter would cause referred pain in the:
questions.rationale: Pain from stones in the upper ureter is referred to the umbilicus due to sensory innervation.

questions.question: Innervation of the bladder and internal urethral sphincter is supplied by:
questions.rationale: Parasympathetic fibers of the ANS innervate the bladder and sphincter.

questions.question: How much urine accumulates in the bladder before stretch receptors trigger micturition?
questions.rationale: Stretch receptors activate at ~250–300 ml, triggering the micturition reflex.

questions.question: What is the trigone?
options: Smooth triangular area between ureter openings and urethra
questions.rationale: The trigone is the smooth triangular region between the ureteral orifices and urethra.

questions.question: GFR is directly related to which factor?
questions.rationale: GFR is determined by perfusion pressure in glomerular capillaries.

questions.question: On average, what % of cardiac output goes to the kidneys?
questions.rationale: Kidneys receive ~1000–1200 ml/min, or ~20–25% of cardiac output.

questions.question: Exercise and posture change renal blood flow by:
questions.rationale: Sympathetic activation reduces renal blood flow with exercise/posture changes.

questions.question: Blood vessels of kidneys are innervated by:
questions.rationale: Sympathetic adrenergic fibers cause vasoconstriction and reduce blood flow.

questions.question: When renin is released, what action occurs?
questions.rationale: Renin cleaves angiotensinogen to form angiotensin I.

questions.question: Effect of natriuretic peptides during heart failure dilation?
questions.rationale: Natriuretic peptides inhibit renin and aldosterone, promoting natriuresis and diuresis.

questions.question: Direct action of atrial natriuretic hormone?
questions.rationale: ANP and BNP promote sodium excretion.

questions.question: Movement of solutes/fluids from tubule to peritubular plasma?
questions.rationale: Tubular reabsorption = movement of solutes/fluid from tubule to plasma.

questions.question: Plasma glucose threshold before glucose appears in urine?
questions.rationale: Glucosuria occurs when plasma glucose >180 mg/dl.

questions.question: Which hormone is required for water reabsorption in distal tubule/collecting duct?
questions.rationale: ADH makes distal tubule/collecting duct permeable to water.

questions.question: Which glycoprotein protects against urolithiasis and is ligand for lymphokines?
questions.rationale: Uromodulin protects against infection, urolithiasis, and binds lymphokines.

questions.question: End product of protein metabolism in urine?
questions.rationale: Urea is the major nitrogenous end product excreted in urine.

questions.question: Action of urodilatin?
questions.rationale: Urodilatin inhibits Na⁺/water reabsorption, promoting diuresis.

questions.question: Which gland secretes ADH?
questions.rationale: ADH is secreted from posterior pituitary.

questions.question: Which statement is true regarding urodilatin?
options: Inhibits NaCl & water reabsorption in medullary collecting duct
questions.rationale: Urodilatin is secreted in response to high BP/volume and inhibits Na⁺/water reabsorption.

questions.question: Substance stimulating renal hydroxylation in vitamin D production?
questions.rationale: PTH stimulates hydroxylation in kidney for active vitamin D.

questions.question: Which hormone is synthesized and secreted by kidneys?
questions.rationale: Kidneys produce erythropoietin.

questions.question: Best estimate of renal function?
questions.rationale: GFR best reflects renal function.

questions.question: Renal change in older adults?
questions.rationale: Aging reduces nephron number.

questions.question: Specific gravity of urine in older adults?
questions.rationale: Older adults tend to have lower urine specific gravity.

questions.question: How do kidneys respond to increased workload?
questions.rationale: Compensatory hypertrophy helps kidneys adapt to workload.

questions.question: Which process allows ureter transplantation success?
questions.rationale: Ureter peristalsis continues even when denervated.

questions.question: Which structures are part of nephron? (Select all)
questions.rationale: Nephron includes renal corpuscle, tubules, loop, and collecting duct. Calyx is not.

questions.question: Which forces create passive transport in proximal tubule? (Select all)
questions.rationale: Passive transport depends on oncotic/osmotic gradients, not hydrostatic.

questions.question: Which hormones are produced by kidney? (Select all)
questions.rationale: Kidneys secrete renin, EPO, and calcitriol. Calcitonin and aldosterone come from other glands.

questions.question: Which statements are true of renal circulation? (Select all)
options: Interlobar arteries travel down renal columns
Arcuate arteries arch over base of pyramids
questions.rationale: Interlobar arteries travel down renal columns and between pyramids; arcuate arch at base.
